metadata.title: CVE-2024-35823 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: vt: fixunicode buffer corruption when deleting characters This is the same issuethat was fixed for the VGA text buffer in commit 39cdb68c64d8 ("vt: fixmemory overlapping when deleting chars in the buffer"). The cure is alsothe same i.e. replace memcpy() with memmove() due to the overlapingbuffers.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'ESM criteria, was needed').
